verb.description: (of a bird or other winged creature) fly unsteadily or hover by flapping the wings quickly and lightly.
examples: a couple of butterflies fluttered around the garden
there was a flutter of wings at the window

phrases: Scarcely an exchange goes by without her flashing her top teeth, fluttering her eyelashes, pursing her lips or cocking her head with a teasing playfulness.
You'll just simper and flutter your eyelashes coyly.
I stood and watched as she flicked her hair over her shoulder and fluttered her eyelashes at the closest guy.
Smiling, I tilted my head toward him and fluttered my eyelashes in what I hoped was a flirty manner.
They fluttered their eyelashes at him from afar.
origin: Old English floterian, flotorian, a frequentative form related to fleet.
